issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing KS, Phone>Sound>Local, the sound volume increased as I moved from .1 through .3. .4 - 1.0 sounded the same level as .3. This occurred with all the sound tests using the cricket sound: Phone>Sound>Local, Phone>Sound>Local with file, and Phone>Sound>Local with file URL. This did not occur on the eris. It is best heard through headphones also this is not a requirement.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Install KS 1.7.0 on a Nexus S
2) Navigate to Phone>Sound>Local and launch test
3) change volume from .3 to .4 and above

Result:
No volume change

Expected Result:
Smooth gain increase throughout the range

Notes:
fields.summary: Android: KitchenSink sound tests - no audible volume difference above .3 level on Nexus S
fields.environment: Nexus S (2.3.2), Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201104280957, Titanium SDK version: 1.7.0 (05/05/11 13:06 1328fa0...)

comments.body: Removed the old scaling factor for 1.5/1.6 devices. Tested on Eris 2.1 and Nexus One 2.3.4.
Verified fixed on Nexus S (2.3.2), Titanium Studio, build: 1.0.0.201105131803, Titanium SDK version: 1.7.X (r187fe3fd). Also checked with Droid 1.
